FeedMessage.description: India, seeded second in Group B, will also clash against South Africa and Sri Lanka, while the opening clash will feature hosts England and Bangladesh at the Oval.
FeedMessage.title: India to begin Champions Trophy defence against Pakistan

FeedMessage.description: The International Boxing Association (AIBA) might have allowed professional boxers to compete in the Olympics but India's biggest pro star Vijender Singh will not be seen in the Rio de Janeiro Games as he hasn't been left with any time or chance to make the cut.
FeedMessage.title: Pro boxers allowed in Olympics but Vijender won't be there

FeedMessage.description: World number one Novak Djokovic became the first player to reach the $100 million prize money mark when he reached the French Open quarter-finals for the 10th time.
FeedMessage.title: Djokovic hits $100m jackpot, into French Open quarters

FeedMessage.description: Prabir Mukherjee was in charge of the Eden Gardens, Kolkata pitches for nearly 25 years and last worked there till the third Twenty20 International between India and South Africa in October last year.
FeedMessage.title: Former Eden Gardens curator Prabir Mukherjee passes away

FeedMessage.description: Nuwan Kulasekara, the Sri Lanka medium-pacer, has announced his retirement from Test cricket, with an intention of concentrating more on limited-over formats.
FeedMessage.title: Nuwan Kulasekara calls time on Test career

FeedMessage.description: The first-of-its-kind training camp-cum-trials for school kids was Schools Games Federation of India's maiden talent search programme where 450 players from across the country took part. Prince, now 15, emerged as the best prospect.
FeedMessage.title: Electrician's son Prince realizes US basketball dream

FeedMessage.description: Cricket Australia on Wednesday announced India A will be taking part in a 50-over quadrangular series to be held in August and September in Townsville and Mackay, which will feature Australia A, South Africa A and Cricket Australiaâ€™s National Performance Squad.
FeedMessage.title: India A to play quadrangular series in Australia

FeedMessage.description: Amir has returned strongly since his five-year ban for spot-fixing was lifted in September last year, taking five wickets in the two one-day internationals against New Zealand in January and as many wickets in 11 Twenty20 games.
FeedMessage.title: Spot-fixing episode is behind Amir, says Pakistan captain

FeedMessage.description: BCCI secretary Ajay Shirke said that the current NCA setup was only a partial facility located in the premises of a member association (KSCA), and the board intended to have a complete high-performance centre preferably in an independent location.
FeedMessage.title: BCCI looking to revamp NCA, says Shirke

FeedMessage.description: When Anthony Martial limped forlornly towards the Old Trafford tunnel, it set Marcus Rashford off on a meteoric rise from unknown teenager to the rising star of England's Euro 2016 challenge in less than 100 days.
FeedMessage.title: Rashford's rise hit new heights with Euro call-up

FeedMessage.description: According to sources, Shreyas Iyer, is set to be picked by Sandeep Patil & Co for the India 'A' team, which will tour of Australia in August for two four-day matches against the hosts and a tri-series involving the 'A' teams of Australia and South Africa.
FeedMessage.title: Shreyas Iyer set to be picked for India 'A' tour

FeedMessage.description: In the first year of its launch, Reliance Foundation Youth Sports' focus will be on eight cities with a defined plan to involve 50 plus cities by 2020, providing an estimate of over 10 lakh school and college students to compete in multi-sports competitions.
FeedMessage.title: School and college sports in India to get a huge makeover

FeedMessage.description: Cook on Monday became the first England cricketer to cross the 10,000-run mark in Tests, and the youngest overall, beating Tendulkar's record by five months by reaching the milestone at the age of 31 years and five months.
FeedMessage.title: Cook can challenge Tendulkar's Test run record: Gavaskar

FeedMessage.description: Former Team India Director Ravi Shastri along with his support staff which include Sanjay Bangar, Bharath Arun and R Sridhar are all set to re-apply after BCCI advertises national coaching positions in the next couple of days.
FeedMessage.title: Shastri, Bangar set to re-apply for India coaching jobs

FeedMessage.description: Mystery surrounds the sudden departure of Pakistan's banned Test leg-spinner, Danish Kaneria and his family to India although his brother claims they have gone to perform some religious rituals.
FeedMessage.title: Mystery surrounds Kaneria's sudden departure to India

FeedMessage.description: Zimbabwe have axed their coach Dav Whatmore and captain Hamilton Masakadza just days before the arrival of India for a five-match limited-overs tour.
FeedMessage.title: Zimbabwe axe coach and captain ahead of India series

FeedMessage.description: Max Verstappen had a dream start with new team in Formula One â€” winning on debut for Red Bull Racing team in Barcelona. But it doesnâ€™t take long for fortunes to turn around in this sport as he was given a rude awakening at the qualifying session for the Monaco Grand Prix last Saturday.
FeedMessage.title: I've a car capable of getting me on podiums: Verstappen

FeedMessage.description: All throughout the 60 matches of the IPL, there was enough entertainment for everyone and a fair share of memorable moments as well. TOI Sports recaps some of those moments of brilliance that made viewers gasp in awe.
FeedMessage.title: Memorable moments of IPL 2016

FeedMessage.description: World number one Novak Djokovic dropped the first set of his French Open last-16 clash against Roberto Bautista Agut before heavy rain came to his rescue Tuesday.
FeedMessage.title: French Open: More rain gives suffering Djokovic shelter

FeedMessage.description: At an official meeting of the technical committee, which was also attended by BCCI president Anurag Thakur, Sourav Ganguly gave the example of Zaheer Khan, who improved as a pacer after his county stint.
FeedMessage.title: Ganguly wants county stints for India players

FeedMessage.description: I am sure they respect Lata ji and Sachin but there is fine line, he said speaking exclusively to India Today.
FeedMessage.title: Asha Bhosle's grandson on Tanmay Bhat video: It wasn't funny, but we don't want an apology

FeedMessage.description: The apex court is hearing an appeal filed by Karnataka challenging the acquittal of the 68-year-old AIADMK chief and three others in the disproportionate assets case.
FeedMessage.title: Jayalalithaa's acquittal in illegal assets case perverse: Karnataka to Supreme Court

FeedMessage.description: An erroneous map put up at Mohammad V University in Rabat showed Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh as parts of India. The gaffe was spotted moments before Vice-President Mohammad Hamid Ansari arrival.
FeedMessage.title: Indian map includes Pak, Bangladesh in Morocco university goof-up while hosting Hamid Ansari

FeedMessage.description: Till a few weeks back, the BJP was following the policy of treating the BSP as its principal opponent, but with the Modi government completing two years in power, the party is ready for a face-off with the SP.
FeedMessage.title: BJP hoping for windfall Muslim votes in 2017 UP elections

FeedMessage.description: The plan, which aims to make India disaster resilient and reduces loss of lives, covers all phases of disaster management - Prevention, Mitigation, Response and Recovery.
FeedMessage.title: PM Modi releases country's first National Disaster Management Plan

FeedMessage.description: The BSEB has put on hold the results of Arts topper Ruby Ray and Science topper Saurabh Sreshtha. The board has announced a review exam for both of them on June 3.
FeedMessage.title: Bihar Board topper says political science is about cooking, will undergo review exam

FeedMessage.description: 37- year-old Shaira Bano has taken her triple talaq case to the Supreme Court and citing it as an 'unfair practice' she has demanded it be abolished in India.
FeedMessage.title: Shaira Bano: The face of the fight against triple talaq

FeedMessage.description: Modi and Rajan have developed a close working rapport, government officials and people close to the governor say.
FeedMessage.title: Modi 'proud' of Raghuram Rajan, Swamy fails to dent RBI governor's image

FeedMessage.description: While NIA had identified most of the people who appeared on the video, there was a confusion over an Indian ISIS recruit Mohammad Khadeer being in the video.
FeedMessage.title: ISIS video: NIA identifies 2 Indian ISIS recuits in the video

FeedMessage.description: Goa CM Minister Laxmikant Parsekar said that people of his state are "annoyed" with the behaviour, attitude and way of life of Nigerians living in the coastal region.
FeedMessage.title: Goans annoyed with Nigerians' attitude, way of life, says CM Parsekar

FeedMessage.description: The villagers in Bishada have now decided to file a complaint against the family of Mohammad Akhlaq.
FeedMessage.title: After Dadri meat is found to be beef, villagers to file complaint against Akhlaq's family

FeedMessage.description: The 40 dead tiger cubs were found in a freezer in a kitchen area, a Thai government official said.
FeedMessage.title: 40 dead tiger cubs found in Thai temple freezer: Key developments

FeedMessage.description: The cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained and the Army has instituted an inquiry into the incident.
FeedMessage.title: Pulgaon ammunition depot fire: Two more bodies recovered, toll climbs to 18

FeedMessage.description: The newly-elected Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said that Tendulkar would be the face of his government's anti-drug campaign.
FeedMessage.title: Sachin Tendulkar to be face of Kerala's anti-drug campaign

FeedMessage.description: A column carried by DPRK Today described Trump as a "wise politician" and the right choice for US voters in the November 8 US presidential election.
FeedMessage.title: North Korea says Trump isn't screwy at all, a wise choice for president

FeedMessage.description: The chorus against triple talaq, among Muslims in the country, is growing. Members of a women's rights group have sought the support of the NCW to abolish the practice of triple talaq.
FeedMessage.title: Time for Uniform Civil Code? 50,000 Muslims sign up against triple talaq

FeedMessage.description: The Iraqi army's assault on Fallujah has begun what is expected to be one of the biggest battles ever fought against Islamic State.
FeedMessage.title: Islamic State halts Iraqi army at gates of Fallujah, civilians in crossfire

FeedMessage.description: Indian Oil Corporation, Hindustan Petroleum and Bharat Petroleum -- revise jet fuel and non-subsidised LPG prices on the first day of every month, based on the average international price.
FeedMessage.title: Non-subsidised LPG price hiked by Rs 21 per cylinder, jet fuel by 9.2 per cent

FeedMessage.description: In a circular issued by the Director-General and Inspector-General of Police Om Prakash, strict actions, including dismissal of the staff, will be taken against those who participate in the protest.
FeedMessage.title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah to use ESMA if cops go on mass strike

FeedMessage.description: The Gandhi scion is set to take charge of the Congress as its president in the next few weeks.
FeedMessage.title: Rahul Gandhi may displace mother Sonia as Congress president in next few weeks

FeedMessage.description: With this change, petrol will cost Rs 65.60 per litre in Delhi after the increase while diesel will cost Rs 53.93 a litre.
FeedMessage.title: Petrol price up by Rs 2.58, diesel by Rs 2.26

FeedMessage.description: An official from the Namyangju fire department said a gas tank used for the welding operations might have exploded.
FeedMessage.title: 4 dead, 10 hurt in South Korean construction explosion

FeedMessage.description: Three of the four SSBNs were to have been equipped to fire Black Shark heavyweight torpedoes, whose purchase the Ministry of Defence (MoD) cancelled last week.
FeedMessage.title: Contract for 98 Black Shark torpedoes scrapped, Indian nuclear submarine programme further delayed

FeedMessage.description: India Today accessed the report prepared in 2011 after Bhandari's name started surfacing in connection with the deal to purchase Basic Jet Trainers (BTAs) for the Indian Air Force.
FeedMessage.title: Robert Vadra was in regular touch with arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari: IB report

FeedMessage.description: The online registration process for more than 60,000 seats will start from Wednesday at 12 and will continue till June 19.
FeedMessage.title: Delhi University admissions begin today, registration a click away
